3555.text: for the Company. Internal control over financial reporting is a process to provide reasonable assurance regarding the

3556.text: reliability of our financial reporting for external purposes in accordance with accounting principles generally

3557.text: accepted in the United States of America. Internal control over financial reporting includes maintaining records that

3558.text: in reasonable detail accurately and fairly reflect our transactions; providing reasonable assurance that transactions

3559.text: are recorded as necessary for preparation of our consolidated financial statements; providing reasonable assurance

3560.text: that receipts and expenditures of company assets are made in accordance with management authorization; and

3561.text: providing reasonable assurance that unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of company assets that could have

3562.text: a material effect on our consolidated financial statements would be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Because

3563.text: of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting is not intended to provide absolute assurance that

3564.text: a misstatement of our consolidated financial statements would be prevented or detected.

3565.text: Management conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based on

3566.text: the framework in Internal Control – Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring

3567.text: Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on this evaluation, management concluded that the Company’s

3568.text: internal control over financial reporting was effective as of June 30, 2023. There were no changes in our internal

3569.text: control over financial reporting during the quarter ended June 30, 2023 that have materially affected, or are

3570.text: reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting. Deloitte & Touche LLP has audited

3571.text: our internal control over financial reporting as of June 30, 2023; their report follows.

3592.text: perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting

3596.text: considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.

3597.title: Definition and Limitations of Internal Control over Financial Reporting

3598.text: A company’s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance

3599.text: regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in

3600.text: accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company’s internal control over financial reporting

3601.text: includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail,

3602.text: accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable

3603.text: assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance

3604.text: with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made

3605.text: only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable

3606.text: assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company’s

3607.text: assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.

3608.text: Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.
